newsitem.title: PANAMA: Panama to build homes on site of infamous prison.
newsitem.headline: Panama to build homes on site of infamous prison.

text.p: Panama plans to build a low-income housing complex on the site of the notorious Modelo prison, which was blasted to rubble this week, Housing Minister Francisco Sanchez Cardenas said on Wednesday.
He told reporters of plans to construct 11 buildings containing two- and three-bedroom apartments. "People won't have to pay more than $17,000 to $18,000," he said.
Modelo prison crumbled to rubble on Tuesday with the touch of a button and the help of about 200 pounds (90 kg) of dynamite.

The destruction of the 71-year-old jail ended what President Ernesto Perez Balladares called a "huge shame." It was at the centre of a scandal in July when local television filmed guards clubbing naked prisoners in a courtyard.
